def pnm.renderer.renderManager.RenderManager.attachAxis (   self,
  node 
)

Attach a debug x-y-z axis to a sceneNode.

The axis is created with a unique name, using RenderManager.__axisCount (increment be one each time) to stop conflicts.

Parameters:
node - SceneNode to attach the axis to
Returns:
The axis mesh entity
def pnm.renderer.renderManager.RenderManager.close (   self  ) 

Safe shutdown and dereference of variables.

This stops circular references stopping the garbage collection

def pnm.renderer.renderManager.RenderManager.displayMesh (   self,
  name,
  parent = None 
)

Display a mesh.

The mesh is created within a new sceneNode which is created within parent

Parameters:
name - name of mesh to be displayed
parent - SceneNode to attach the mesh to (default, RenderManager.sceneNode)
Returns:
tuple; The mesh entity, the sceneNode containing the entity
def pnm.renderer.renderManager.RenderManager.getCamera (   self  ) 

Get the camera object.

Returns:
a reference to RenderManager.__camera

See also:

def pnm.renderer.renderManager.RenderManager.quit (   self,
  do = False 
)

Access or set the quit flag.

If False is passed (or do is ommited), then the current state of quit is returned. If True is passed, RenderManager.__quit is set to True and the renderer will quit at the start of the next render loop (inside WindowEventListener.frameStarted )

Parameters:
do - True to set the renderer to quite, False (default) to query the value of RenderManager.__quit
Returns:
RenderManager.__quit if do is False
See also:
WindowEventListener.frameStarted
def pnm.renderer.renderManager.RenderManager.setup (   self,
  pluginConfig = None,
  resourcesConfig = "resources.cfg",
  restoreConfig = False 
)

Setup the renderer, window, viewport and sceneManager.

Parameters:
pluginConfig - plugin config file location, full path (default, "./plugins/plugins.cfg")
resourcesConfig - resource config file name (default, "resources.cfg")
restoreConfig - True to restore the OGRE config file, or False to run the OGRE config dialog
Returns:
False if the setup failed or was canceled
def pnm.renderer.renderManager.RenderManager.start (   self  ) 

Start the render loop.

def pnm.renderer.renderManager.RenderManager.update (   self,
  timeElapsed 
)

Update the render manager with the time elapsed in the last frame.

Called in scripts.render_frameStarted
